summary: This document is an email chain between federal prosecutors and law enforcement discussing whether to extend the sealing of a 'triggerfish' warrant related to Ghislaine Maxwell. The participants debate the justification for continued sealing, with one prosecutor indicating they likely cannot justify extended sealing. The warrant materials are attached for reference.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The 'triggerfish' warrant mentioned in the email chain is related to her. She is the central subject of the legal discussion.

persons.name: Mr. Frorr
persons.context: Sent a holiday greeting and forwarded an inquiry about extending the seal on the Maxwell triggerfish warrant.

events.title: Inquiry about Warrant Seal Extension
events.description: An inquiry is made via email about whether the seal on the Ghislaine Maxwell triggerfish warrant needs to be extended, as it is set to expire soon.

events.title: Prosecutors Discuss Warrant Sealing
events.description: Federal prosecutors and law enforcement officials exchange emails discussing the justification for seeking an extended sealing of the Ghislaine Maxwell triggerfish warrant, with one prosecutor stating they likely cannot justify it.

keyFacts: A 'triggerfish' warrant related to Ghislaine Maxwell was under seal and set to expire in late December 2020.
Federal prosecutors (USANYS, USANH) and law enforcement (FBI, NYPD) were debating whether to seek an extension of that seal.
One prosecutor expressed the opinion that they could not justify seeking an extended sealing at that point.
The warrant materials were attached to the email chain for reference.
The correspondence shows ongoing legal and investigative activity regarding Maxwell in December 2020, shortly after her arrest.
